questions.question: He told me ……………………………… he had found a good job.
questions.description: That is a simple connector used to introduce a noun-clause.

questions.question: ……………………… she heard the news, she fainted.
questions.description: As soon as is used to suggest that one action quickly followed another.

questions.question: He started early ....................... he wouldn't get stuck in traffic.
…………………………. he was at home, why didn't he talk to us?
He lives in a deserted place ........................ there is no one to keep him company.
questions.description: We can use where to introduce adverb clauses of place.

questions.question: They were tired and hungry, .................... they didn't give up.
questions.description: We use but to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: She earns a lot more ....................... she needs.
questions.description: We use than after a comparative expression.

questions.question: ………………………… you miss this opportunity, it will be hard to find another one.
………………………… you mend your ways, you will be in serious trouble.
The farmer killed the hen ………………………….. laid a golden egg every day.
questions.description: Either which or that is possible here.
